column5: If an offspring becomes a better fisherperson than the teacher...you can rest assured your life was fulfilled  Welcome aboard
You lost me at tiller and found me at Yami. Welcome aboard Chris.
Welcome aboard Chris.If you want to know what it feels like to be constantly out fished by your kid, I'm sure Ican fill you in -I seem to have lots of experience in that.
Welcome aboard Chris,also looking forward to your input!!!!
Welcome to the Gong Show.
Welcome ! Glad to see another local here... adventurous wife eh ? seems to be more and more of them popping up since they released 50 shades .

Hello Everyone.  I have been lurking on this board for quite some time now and have finally decided it was time to come out of the woodwork and begin contributing to this informative and interesting site.  I currently live in Kitcher and have been in this area for most of my life. My two favaourite fishing partners are my overly adventurous wife and my 13 year old son. Who I think will be a better fisherman some day than I am.  My current fishing includes great lakes trolling (Mostly Lake Erie) and jigging walleye, perch and bass out of my Lund tiller and 80 hp Yami. In the last couple of years, I have also enjoyed Kayak fishing with my wife in smaller lakes or rivers. Except for the one trip she talked me into paddling 5 miles offshore of longpoint. Good thing we hammered the perch.  I aslo enjoy fall fishing for Stealies and ice fishing. It's great that this sport has something to offer in every season.  I look forward to sharing our adventures with all of you   See you on the water Chris
Welcome
Welcome Chris,  Enjoy the good, ignore the bad, and don't take comments too seriously.  Main thing is to enjoy yourself.  Tom.
Great introduction and welcome to the forum
Welcome aboard Chris. Looking forward to reading of your adventures.
Welcome aboard Chris.
Welcome aboard Chris.   Looking forwards to some of your reports myself.
Welcome aboard Chris.  Aren't overly adventurous wives great
Welcome to the loonie bin. And don't forget...we don't believe anything without pics.
good intro and welcome to the site.
I live in Kitchener too ...maybe we could "boatpool" sometimes
Great intro....welcome to the site Chris.....where do you ice fish?
Welcome aboard Chris looking forward to reading your reports
Welcome Chris!  I look forward to hearing about your upcoming adventures!  Tight lines!

Wow, quite the welcome. Don't any of you work. Oh ya..... that's where I am now.   Joey. This lady really keeps me hopin. From hiking like a billygoat through the Niagara Gorge last weekend, to whitewater kayaking with our sit on top's. The list goes on, but it keeps me young.  Fireball. I've been in the loony bin for a long time... should fit in just fine here. And here's a pic of last weekend...... just to show I do fish  Should'nt be too hard to figure out where this is.   iFish4real. Anytime. I travel to the big lakes most weekends through the summer. Always looking for a good netman  Limeyangler. Mostly Lake Simcoe, But Irealy enjoy Georgian Bay when there is enough ice.
Nice introdution. Seems like you have a well rounded outdoors family. Simcoe and gbay are very close here.  Havent fished the Nia river in ages.Great fishery.   Welcome Chris,enjoy your stay.
Welcome aboard. (NF)
Another member!
Seems fishing related to me, don't worry bout the class clowns. You may or may not get used to them......
Hey I resemble that remark....  I think....
Sorry it seemed funny at the time
Hey Terry.  No worries. If there is one thing about me..... I can always take a joke.
